item.title: Assignment 1
item.description: Assignment 1 - AC power Forjanic Remy (511448), EEL1V.IB Question 1 $pf = 0.75$, $f = 50\text{Hz}$, $V_{rms} = 230\text{V}$

item.title: Assignment 2
item.description: Assignment 2 - Transformers Forjanic Remy (511448), EEL1V.IB $R_{1} = \frac{511448}{10000}=51.1448\ohm$ $f = 50\text{Hz}$ Question 1 Calculate the turns ratio of the transformer

item.title: Assignment 3
item.description: Assignment 3 - Rectifier Forjanic Rémy (511448) $C_{1} = \frac{511448}{1000} = 511.448\mu f$ $U_{max} = 24V$ $f = 50Hz$ Question 1 - Half wave rectifier Calculate the average voltage across the load and the voltage ripple.

item.title: Bipolar Junction Transistor
item.description: > Dashboard > Analogue Electronics Transistor structure The npn bipolar transistor contains a thin p-region between two n-regions. The three regions and their terminal connections are called the emitter, base and collector.

item.description: > Dashboard yellow Here is a note! orange Here is a note! peach Here is a note! grape

item.title: Electrics Circuits AC
item.description: > Dashboard Summary

item.title: Field effect transistor
item.description: > Dashboard > Analogue Electronics FET vs BJT FET BJT • 3 terminal device • 3 terminal device emitter to collector $e^{-}$ current controlled by the current injected into the base.

item.title: Lesson 1
item.description: > Dashboard > Differential Equation & Laplace Equation An equation is an expression of a relationship between quantities, also called variables or unknowns.

item.title: Lesson 2
item.description: > Dashboard > Differential Equation & Laplace Serparating variables A differential equation has two variables. For some differential equations it is possible to separate the variables: on the left-hand-side there is just the dependent and on the right-hand-side just the independent variable.

item.title: Lesson 3
item.description: > Dashboard > Differential Equation & Laplace Direction field A differential equation can be visualised in a sol called direction field.

item.title: Lesson 4
item.description: > Dashboard > Differential Equation & Laplace Linear first-order homogenous differential equations General form: $\frac{dx}{dt} + p(t)\cdot x = 0$

item.title: Lesson 5
item.description: > Dashboard > Differential Equation & Laplace Non homogenous differential equation $$\frac{dx}{dt} + p(t)\cdot x = r(t)$$ If $r(t) \neq 0$ then this linear differential equation is not homogenous.

item.title: Lesson 6
item.description: > Dashboard > Differential Equation & Laplace Linear higher-order differential equations General form: $$a_{n} \frac{d^{n}x}{dt^{x}} + a_{n-1} \frac{d^{n-1}x}{dt^{n-1}}+\cdots + a_{1}\frac{dx}{dt}+a_{0}x = r(t)$$ if $r(t) = 0$ then the differential equation is homogeneous.

item.title: Lesson 7
item.description: > Dashboard > Differential Equation & Laplace Boundary values If we want to solve a specific second-order differential equation, two boundary values are necessary.

item.title: Lesson 8
item.description: > Dashboard > Differential Equation & Laplace

item.title: Semiconductor diodes
item.description: > Dashboard > Analogue Electronics Diode A diode is an electrical component that allows the flow of current in only one direction.

item.title: Summary
item.description: > Dashboard > Electrics Circuits AC Capacitor $$Z_{C} = \frac{1}{j\omega C}$$ $Z_{C}: $ impedance $[\Omega]$ $\omega: $ angular frequency $[\text{rad}\cdot\text{s}^{-1}]$

item.title: Week 1
item.description: > Dashboard > Power Circuits Electrical Power - DC $$P = U\cdot I = R\cdot I^{2}=\frac{U^{2}}{R}$$ $P:$ power in $\text{W}$

item.title: Week 2
item.description: > Dashboard > Power Circuits Transformers A transformer is an electrical device that transfer energy between two circuits through electromagnectic induction.
